title: When you see a low health enemy

replies.body: I'm still miffed about that "Z attack" thing they gave him.

> [{quoted}](name=Blue Moon Wolf,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=37ITHWWU,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-09-04T11:02:20.571+0000)
>
> I'm still miffed about that "Z attack" thing they gave him.

what do you mean by 'miffed'

Pretty much this:

 http://mrwgifs.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Jimmies-Maximum-Over-Rustled-Meme-Gif.gif

But in a way that sounds more relaxed about it .__.
(I was expecting a mega evolution for him)
how do you even give the fattest pokemon a MEGA evolution??? like what make him fatter?

It makes him Swole
http://i.imgur.com/vzCIEKT.jpg

He releases his stored energy, making him buff up: 

http://www.j1studios.com/wordpress/wp-content/uploads/commission__traein_17_by_mtc_studios-d6l65ge.png
By weight and by size, Snorlax is actually outclassed by Groudon and Wailord respectively.
Something to think about: A freshly hatched Snorlax is the strongest Pokémon that can be hatched in the game. Besides hacked legendary eggs. Strange but true fact.
But munchlax is the baby pokemon for snorelax

While this IS true, it requires you to have a Lax Incense held by one of the parents. Otherwise you will always get a Snorlax.

And its base stats are... Well... [Really high.](http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Snorlax_(Pok%C3%A9mon)#Base_stats)

HP: 160
Attack: 110
Defense: 65
Special Attack: 65
Special Defense: 110
Speed: 30

i thought we were using the actual pokemon universe over gameplay mechanics the only reason you need the Lax incense is because Muchlax didnt exist when snorlax came out and the creators had too pull something out their as*hole

I'm talking about gameplay usually when it comes to Pokémon. Though in the Pokémon universe (aka the anime)... Everything is very different and we could find discrepancies EVERYWHERE once we start comparing the two. Like in the first Generation. Pikachu dealing damage with Thundershock to an Onix who is a Rock/Ground type (Ground types being IMMUNE to Electric type moves).

Honestly. Ash is the worst trainer.

"What's that, the Other Trainer has an Onix, a Golem, and Regirock? Better Send Pikachu out!"

Meanwhile Pikachu: "AT LEAST EVOLVE ME FIRST YOU TWAT. I'M STUCK AT LACKLUSTER STATS BECAUSE YOU WON'T LET ME BE A RAICHU"

In game Pikachu: Yeah it has lackluster stats...

In the anime series: Ash's Pikachu defies all game stat limits and goes the Gurren Laggan route of crazy strong in a small package.

Well damage wise pikachu can become absurd with a light orb or whatever that item was called.

Then again though, that's a gimmick.

Correct the item IS a Light Orb, interestingly enough it even has a unique effect when used while breeding a Pikachu. You can get a Pichu with Volt Tackle at level 1 guaranteed.

Another interesting Pokémon and item combo is an HA Flareon with a Toxic Orb. With Guts it ends up boosting its already high Attack stat to even higher levels due to it getting poisoned.
didn't pikachu insist on staying a pikachu instead of evolving?
Indeed, Ash once almost forced the thunderstone upon Pikachu because he couldn't win vs a Raichu.

Shh, Pikachu it's okay

Nurse Joy knows best~
To be fair, the onyx was immune to the electricity, but pikachu used it to trip the sprinkler system. Still bullshit, but less of a slap of the face to the game.
Yeah, still some was bullshit involved.

I personally like the Z-moves, if only for how cheesy they are.

Also, I was laughing for ten straight minutes when I first saw it.
It was all fine till I saw this: http://pokeinfo.net/post_pic/2016/20160801_11.jpg
That's the Killer Queen pose from Jojo. That's literally what that is.
huh... neat. Interesting that they would make a reference like that. Still looks ridiculous though, I hope you can change it (not likely but I can hope).
As long as Z-moves don't replace megas I will be fine. I heard this month's Coro coro will be focusing on evolution, so my fingers are crossed.

Supposedly according to "leaks" they won't release any new megas. (maybe not true, but seems true so far, i mean didn't they announce mega evolutions earier than this last time?)
you can still mega evolve, but there won't be any new ones. (once again according to leaks not confirmed true)
Z-moves may change the pokemons appearance (like mega evolution, think ash-greninja). (once again leak)

Well, if they KEEP all the old megas, I will still be a little disappointed but not furious. We still haven't seen the "secret" that rockruff and the starters have, and I think it will be evolution based. Maybe that's the Z-move change you heard of (synchro evolutions?). We already have zygarde mega-evolving under a certain condition, so it may be that a similar thing will be added to other Pokemon, like a mega stone but automatic and possibly stronger, after reaching the health threshold. So many questions..

Supposedly its different evolutions under different circumstances (which i wouldn't be disappointed about).
Leak says that rockruff will evolve into 3 different "werewolf" based creatures, which would be cool.
